intro: Heptapleurum agamae, commonly known as the African nettle, is a perennial shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and can grow up to 2 meters in height. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and its roots are often used in traditional medicine. The plant is characterized by its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments.
